revised_title: Wave-Lengths of Enhanced Lines in the Spectra of Various Elements
tldr: The author investigates the enhanced lines in the spectra of various elements, such as aluminum, bismuth, chromium, copper, iron, magnesium, manganese, titanium, and vanadium, using a large 42-inch Spottiswoode coil and a 6-inch concave grating. The wave-lengths of these enhanced lines are determined and compared to solar spectra, providing valuable information for the study of stellar spectra.
